title: Police trace two missing children in Kerala’s Kozhikode
content: Search on for one more minor boy who escaped with the other two from Government Children’s Home on Thursday evening

title: Pakistan expels Indian high commission staffer
content: India on Wednesday, May 21, expelled a Pakistani official working at the Pakistan high commission on charges of involvement in espionage

title: Maharashtra launches Mahavistar App ahead of Kharif Season
content: As the Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) has forecasted heavy rainfall across Maharashtra, Mr. Fadnavis has instructed officials to ensure that farmers receive seeds and fertiliser on time

title: Search operation underway in J&K's Kishtwar
content: The exchange of fire with suspected terrorists is going on in Shingpora area of Chhatru in J&K’s Kishtwar district

title: Waqf (Amendment) Act hearing LIVE: Supreme Court to continue hearing pleas challenging the constitutional validity of the law
content: The Centre argued that waqf, though an Islamic concept, is not an essential religious practice and that waqf boards perform secular functions

title: Water-sharing dispute: Punjab holds ‘victory rally’
content: Punjab CM Mann says Punjabis  didn’t allow Haryana and the Centre to take away even a single drop of water

title: BJP MLA  Kanwar Lal Meena surrenders in Rajasthan court after a 3-year sentence in 2005 case
content: Supreme Court recently upheld his three-year rigorous imprisonment for ‘pointing a pistol at a Sub-Divisional Magistrate during an election’; no decision yet on his disqualification from House

title: Murshidabad violence:  BJP Trinamool spar over fact finding report
content: The report by the three member committee had highlighted the presence of local Trinamool Congress leaders including local councillor and MLA at the site of violence. The report which was submitted before the division bench of Justice Soumen Sen and Justice Raja Basu Chowdhury also added that the West Bengal Police did not respond to calls by the locals.

title: When ganja seeds begin to sprout in public places
content: The Excise team that reached the spot found that suspicion to be true as they ‘took into custody’ the 63-cm-long plant visible amid shrubs and weeds.

title: Gadkari has promised swift action against those responsible for NH-66 collapse near Kooriyad bridge: IUML leader
content: Speaking to reporters in New Delhi, Mr. Basheer said he had called on Mr Gadkari to apprise him of the grave public concern following the collapse of a significant portion of the NH-66 near the Kooriyad Bridge.

title: Should water be used as a weapon? | Explained
content: What does the Indus Waters Treaty provide for? How has it been able to withstand three major wars between India and Pakistan? How have disputes surrounding India’s hydropower projects been arbitrated? How have other countries dealt with cross-border river disputes?

title: Navodayam 2.0: Andhra Pradesh govt. sets September 30 deadline to become ID Liquor-free
content: Excise Principal Secretary Mukesh Kumar Meena lays out comprehensive strategy for intensified enforcement, calling for district-specific plans and visible results

title: Officials told to take measures to achieve 15% growth rate in allied agricultural sectors in A.P.
content: Agriculture Minister Atchannaidu assesses preparedness for kharif season and asks officials to ensure availability of seeds and fertilizers

title: A.P. CM takes part in Gangamma temple jatara in Kuppam, offers silk vastrams to deity
content: Estimated 3 lakh devotees from Kuppam constituency, and neighbouring Tamil Nadu and Karnataka take part in the annual festival

title: Supriya Sule demands judicial inquiry into dowry death allegations against Pune NCP leader
content: The National Commission for Women on May 19 took cognisance of the alleged dowry harassment and death of Vaishnavi Hagawane, daughter-in-law of NCP leader Rajendra Hagawane

title: Confusion over Persian lizard removed after 150 years
content: While Mesalina watsonana has been a key species in the study of desert lizard diversity across South and Central Asia, confusion over its syntypes across museums in Kolkata, London, and Vienna posed a challenge

title: Telephone tapping case: Prabhakar Rao will be proclaimed offender if he fails to appear before court by June 20
content: According to police department, he ‘fled the country’ on learning that the telephone tapping case was registered.

title: Assassinated leaders Farooq and Lone believed dialogue was the best way: Mirwaiz
content: The Mirwaiz paid tributes to his late father and also remembered Khawaja Abdul Ghani Lone Sahab and the “70 innocent mourners who died in the Hawal massacre on the same date.”

title: 17 local bodies get 4.5 acres of govt. land for setting up waste management facilities
content: The land cannot be used for other purposes and local bodies cannot lease, sub-lease, or pledge it with any financial institution. Construction of waste treatment plants and material collection facilities must begin within a year of allotment

title: Miss India among 24 finalists for Miss World 2025 talent competition
content: The finalists were chosen after a series of internal auditions and a competitive rounds held privately at the hotel where the 108 contestants are staying

title: Gang murders 27-year-old man in Ranipet after row over rash driving
content: The victim had earlier complained to police over threats to his life. Angered over the police not acting on the complaint filed by him, residents blocked Nemili-Panapakkam main road; they dispersed after the police promised prompt action

title: Priyanka urges CM to expedite relief measure for landslide victims in Wayanad
content: Several interim measures announced by the government following the tragedy are yet to be implemented, leaving victims struggling to rebuild their lives, she says in letter to Chief Minister

title: SIT report on Murshidabad violence has exposed TMC’s ‘anti-Hindu brutality’, says BJP
content: BJP spokesperson Sudhanshu Trivedi claimed SIT findings showed planned targeting of Hindus, and questioned Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on action against party leaders and police inaction during the April riots.

title: Migrant girl’s journey now part of Kerala’s school curriculum
content: A memoir in the form of a letter to a friend—where Dharaksha Parveen recalls her childhood in Bihar and how her life changed after moving to Kerala—has been included in the new textbook for Class VI in Kerala.

title: Maoists desperate to regain lost ground in Andhra-Odisha Border after Basavaraju’s death
content: With tribal sympathisers refusing to join Maoists and combing operations getting intensified, the Left Wing extremists find it hard to strengthen their footing in AOB region

title: J&K Govt. offices ordered to stop using unofficial digital platforms
content: The government also barred the use of personal email services such as Gmail, Yahoo, or Rediffmail for any official communication

title: Ruling National Conference’s working committee meets in Srinagar, seeks special status, statehood
content: Party reaffirms commitment to peaceful democratic struggle, condemns violence, and appeals to India and Pakistan to seek lasting peace

title: EPFO adds 7.54 lakh new subscribers in March
content: Of the total new subscribers added in March, 58.94% are in the 18-25 years age group; around 2.08 lakh new female subscribers joined in March

title: Basavaraju was trained by LTTE in jungle warfare, military tactics and IED use
content: Known for his daredevil attitude, the slain general secretary of CPI (Maoist) led many operations, including the attack on the CRPF camp in Dantewada in which 76 personnel were killed in 2010

title: Congress demands action against Malviya, Goswami for 'defaming' Rahul Gandhi, party
content: Congress General Secretary Jairam Ramesh said multiple complaints have been filed against Amit Malviya and Arnab Goswami in different parts of the country

title: World needs to be told the truth, says DMK MP Kanimozhi
content: The DMK Parliamentary Party leader is heading an eight-member delegation to five countries, including Russia, as part of Centre’s diplomatic offensive in the wake of conflict with Pakistan

title: All parties should support PM on national security issues, says Sule
content: The NCP-SP leader’s remarks come in the wake of questions raised by Congress and other parties about the diplomatic outreach; Sule, who is heading a multi-party delegation, says all parties had earlier agreed not to politicise the war on terror

title: Creation of waqfs is not an essential religious practice of Islam: Centre
content: A Muslim who does not create a waqf would not be less Muslim or cease to be a Muslim, says Solicitor-General; he stresses that the amended law only focuses on administrative aspects

title: MGNREGA wages must rise to ₹400 per day: Jairam Ramesh
content: Citing a LibTech India report, Mr. Ramesh noted a mismatch in registered households and actual work provided; says wage rates have stagnated for a decade and need systematic review by a Standing Committee

title: J&K Lt. Governor announces government jobs for kin of Pakistan shelling victims
content: Manoj Sinha vows enhanced border infrastructure and security, praises bravery of residents and soldiers amid recent tensions

title: Development of longer range BrahMos missile as well as sleeker BrahMos-NG variant on track
content: Expected to be ready for flight testing in a year or two, the new BrahMos-NG is a sleeker missile than the current variants, and will be much lighter at half the weight of the current air launched missile

title: PM to inaugurate 103 Amrit Bharat railway stations on May 22
content: Over 1,300 stations are being redeveloped across the country under the Amrit Bharat Station Scheme (ABSS), with a blend of modern facilities and regional architecture, a Railways Ministry spokesperson stated

title: LDF govt. trying to weaken Panchayat Raj system: Sunny Joseph
content: KPCC president terms the ongoing ward delimitation unscientific and unilateral and in line with the preferences of the ruling party

title: Basavaraju’s killing a major achievement for security forces: ex-adviser to Home Ministry
content: Basavaraju was an expert in handling explosives, and more prone to violence when compared with  Mullapalla Rao alias Ganapathi, his predecessor, K. Vijay Kumar, former Special Security Advisor, Ministry of Home Affairs said

title: ED searches on educational institutions linked to Parameshwara leads to political storm
content: Raids covered 16 locations in connection with the gold smuggling case allegedly involving Kannada actor Ranya Rao

title: ₹956.16 cr. cut from Kerala’s IGST share, says Finance dept.
content: Finance Minister says Centre has slashed IGST shares of all States on the grounds that excess amounts have been credited to them. Under this decision, Kerala’s IGST share has been reduced by ₹956.16 crore. However, there is a lack of clarity regarding the excess settlements

title: Manipur government orders probe into bus incident, Meitei group calls 48-hour strike
content: The Coordinating Committee on Manipur Integrity demanded an apology from the Governor and the resignation of the State’s Security Advisor, Chief Secretary, and DGP

title: Summer cut short, monsoon on the horizon for Telangana
content: Region is already witnessing pre-monsoon showers and day temperatures have plummeted with the humidity being on the higher side due to the Easterlies from the Bay of Bengal: TGDPS

title: Mallikarjun Kharge’s remarks insult to defence forces: BJP
content: “The people of the country are watching who is standing with the soldiers, and who is speaking in Pakistan’s tune,” the Minister said

title: Collector seeks report on crack found on NH 66 in Manathala
content: Collector forms a high-level expert committee to conduct a joint inspection and submit a comprehensive report

title: NBA conference finals takeaways: Pacers' miraculous OT Game 1 comeback over Knicks
content: Here's what has stood out from the latest playoff games of the Eastern and Western conference finals.

title: Longtime Colts owner and CEO Irsay dies at 65
content: Jim Irsay, who had led the Colts since 1997 and presided over one of the storied franchise's greatest eras, died Wednesday.

title: Haliburton's wild shot keys Pacers in G1 stunner
content: Tyrese Haliburton sent Game 1 to overtime with a dramatic buzzer-beater, and the Pacers pulled off their latest playoff comeback in a 138-135 win over the Knicks.

title: Stars use 3rd-period flurry to take G1 from Oilers
content: The Stars scored three straight power-play goals early in the third period and rode the momentum to a 6-3 win over the Oilers in their Western Conference final opener Wednesday night.

title: Thunder's SGA bests Jokic again to win first MVP
content: The Thunder's Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, who averaged 32.7 points to win the league's scoring title, has earned his first NBA MVP, finishing ahead of Nikola Jokic.

title: Wolves' Edwards fined for postgame profanity
content: The NBA fined Wolves star Anthony Edwards $50,000 for "using profane language" during a news conference following Minnesota's Game 1 loss to Oklahoma City.

title: Sources: Tempers flare in tense tush push debate
content: Debate over the tush push led to a heated exchange between NFL owners and league executives, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: Pulisic won't play for U.S. at Gold Cup
content: AC Milan and United States attacker Christian Pulisic won't be part of the team that takes part in the Gold Cup, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Son ends Spurs drought: 'Let's say I'm a legend'
content: Captain Son Heung-Min accepted the tag of Spurs legend after lifting the club's first trophy in 17 years following a victory in Wednesday's Europa League final.

content: From the Los Angeles Chargers to Lane Johnson, here's how the NFL world reacted to the failed tush push ban.

title: Stop worrying and celebrate the tush push -- all the reasons it deserved to live
content: Some believe the play is unstoppable, and now it has proved unkillable -- even for the NFL and its owners.

title: Ange Postecoglou keeps his two-year promise with long-awaited trophy for Tottenham
content: Tottenham Hotspur ended a 17-year drought by winning the Europa League, as Manchester United go back to square one on a disappointing season.

content: Manny Pacquiao has won titles in eight divisions, but even for him, Father Time could be a tough opponent to beat.

content: We predicted the NFL's top rookies in 10 different stats for the 2025 season. Who will dominate box scores this fall?

content: Starting with a pair of players on the verge of the majors, let's rank baseball's next wave of stars.

content: With celebrity owners such as Natalie Portman and cool lifestyle merch drops, Angel City is a preeminent brand in women's soccer. Is being a good soccer team next?

title: Amorim: Won't seek payoff if Utd don't want me
content: Ruben Amorim has said he will not seek compensation from Manchester United if they decide he is not the right man for the job after the Europa League final defeat to Tottenham Hotspur.

title: 'Serial winner' Ange unsure on future: 'Que sera'
content: BILBAO, Spain -- Tottenham Hotspur boss Ange Postecoglou has insisted he is unaware of any meetings about his future at the club, but said "whatever happens, happens" after ending Spurs' 17-year wait for a trophy.

title: Sources: Endrick out of CWC, Bellingham set for op
content: Real Madrid forward Endrick will be out for two months and miss the Club World Cup with a hamstring injury, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: NWSL's Boston to play 1st season at Gillette
content: Boston Legacy, a 2026 NWSL expansion franchise, will play its first season at Gillette Stadium in Foxborough, Massachusetts, due to delays with the redevelopment of its proposed home stadium.

title: Flick signs new Barcelona deal after LaLiga win
content: Barcelona coach Hansi Flick has extended his contract with the club after guiding them to the LaLiga trophy, signing a new deal until 2027.

title: Sources: USMNT's Cardoso top target for Atlético
content: Johnny Cardoso is Atlético Madrid's top target as they look to strengthen the midfield line in the summer transfer window, sources have told ESPN.

content: A vote Tuesday paved the way for players such as Patrick Mahomes and Tyreek Hill to play Olympic flag football.

title: Ex-CEO Of Ocean Theme Parks Defends Record After Dolphin Deaths
content: Another dolphin has died in an aquatic park operated by The Dolphin Company, the fifth in the last year as an executive and lenders fight for control of the bankrupt company.

title: "Depraved Act Of Anti-Semitic Terror": 2 Israeli Embassy Staff Killed In US
content: Two staff members of the Israeli Embassy in Washington, DC, were shot and killed on Wednesday evening near the Jewish Museum, in an incident described by Israeli officials as an act of anti-Semitic terrorism.

title: Who Is The Mysterious Founder Of China's DeepSeek
content: Despite the global hype around China's DeepSeek, very little is known about the man behind it - Liang Wenfeng.

title: Man Molests Minor Girl, Threatens Her With Cobra, Arrested: Kota Police
content: Police have arrested a 29-year-old man for allegedly molesting a minor girl by scaring her with a cobra he kept illegally at his home, and cheating people, officials said.

title: On Camera, Chilling Moment Woman Admitted To Killing Her Baby 30 Years Ago
content: A New York woman calmly confessed to burning and strangling her baby boy in an Albany park about 30 years ago.

content: Israel has "probably" killed Mohammed Sinwar, de facto leader of Hamas in Gaza, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Wednesday.

content: At least 3-4 terrorists are reportedly trapped after an encounter broke out in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar early on Thursday.

content: Not all secrets were heard on wiretaps or caught on hidden cameras during the Cold War. Some were whispered in bedrooms, between lovers who didn't know they were pawns in a much bigger game.

title: IMD Predicts Heavy Rainfall In Parts Of West Coast
content: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) reported heavy rainfall across several states from 8:30 AM IST on Thursday to 5:30 AM IST on Friday.

title: Mamata Banerjee Pays Tribute To Raja Ram Mohan Roy On His Birth Anniversary
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday paid tributes to social reformer Raja Ram Mohan Roy on his birth anniversary and described him as a pioneer figure of Indian modernity.

title: Sensex Tanks 720 Points In Early Trade, Nifty Down 220 Points
content: The domestic benchmark indices opened lower on Thursday amid negative global cues as selling was seen in the IT and auto sectors in the early trade.

content: A serious accident occurred on Wednesday during the launch of a new North Korean warship while Kim Jong Un was attending the event, with the isolated state's leader calling it a "criminal act" that could not be tolerated.

title: NDTV Ground Report: China's Unconventional War Against India On Northeast Border
content: On the surface, life appears normal in Dimapur, Nagaland. But scratch a little, and decades of decay and turmoil are evident.

title: Will IndiGo Curb Deal With Turkish Airlines After Op Sindoor? What CEO Said
content: IndiGo, which is facing calls for ending or curbing its codeshare agreement with Turkish Airlines, is "fully compliant" with regulations in India but is open to making changes if the rules are altered, the airline's CEO Pieter Elbers has said.

title: 2,600 Km Tech Trail: Exam Cheaters In Arunachal Get Answers From Haryana
content: 53 candidates have been arrested for attempting to use advanced electronic devices, including GSM-enabled gadgets and micro earpieces, to cheat during the exams.

title: PM Modi To Visit Karni Mata Temple In Rajasthan Today, Address Rally
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday will visit the revered Karni Mata Temple in Deshnok in Rajasthan's Bikaner, and is likely to deliver a significant message from the spiritual land of Maa Karni.

title: Watch: US Launches Nuclear-Capable Minuteman III In Doomsday Missile Test
content: The US military clarified that the Minuteman III missile launch test was routine and "not a response to current world events".

title: '8th time Trump made this claim': Cong questions PM Modi's 'silence' on India-Pak
content: Congress leader Pawan Khera has criticized Prime Minister Modi's silence regarding President Trump's repeated claims of brokering peace between India and Pakistan. Trump asserted he used trade negotiations to halt 'Operation Sindoor,' a claim India refutes.

title: SBI bank manager who refused to speak Kannada in Bengaluru's Chandapura transferred
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah condemned an SBI branch manager in Chandapura for refusing to speak Kannada with a customer, sparking public outrage and protests. Following the incident, which was captured in a viral video, the manager was transferred. MP Tejasvi Surya also criticized the manager's behavior, emphasizing the importance of communicating in the local language.

title: Pakistan expels Indian high commission official
content: Pakistan has expelled an Indian high commission staff member, mirroring India's expulsion of a Pakistani official for alleged spying. This reciprocal action escalates tensions following a terror attack in Jammu & Kashmir and India's subsequent strikes on terror camps. Despite Pakistan's attempted retaliation, a ceasefire was established after discussions between top army officers from both nations.

title: Walmart Boycott: America's largest retailer to protestors, 'We remain ...'
content: The People's Union USA is spearheading a nationwide boycott of Walmart from May 20-26, protesting the retailer's labor practices and community impact. The group alleges economic corruption and criticizes the rollback of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion efforts. Following the Walmart boycott, Target and McDonald's are slated for similar economic blackouts in June.

title: Gold & silver price prediction: What's the rate outlook for today?
content: Gold and silver price prediction: MCX Gold is poised for an upswing, potentially reaching Rs 98,000 if it breaches the Rs 95,700 resistance, supported by a positive RSI trend. Similarly, MCX Silver's breakout from its consolidation range suggests a climb to Rs 1,01,800, fueled by rising bullish momentum. Traders should monitor key support levels for both metals.

title: In first delivery since March, UN dispatches 90 aid trucks to Gaza
content: Amid mounting global pressure, Israel allowed a UN aid convoy into Gaza, the first since early March, as Prime Minister Netanyahu considers a temporary ceasefire. Despite this, military operations continue, with Gaza's health ministry reporting numerous deaths. The limited aid delivery is insufficient to address the dire humanitarian crisis, leaving civilians struggling for basic supplies and facing unbearable conditions.

title: 'You don’t want to concede 48 in last two overs' - DC coach
content: Delhi Capitals' IPL 2025 campaign ended in disappointment after a promising start, failing to reach the playoffs. A crushing defeat to Mumbai Indians, fueled by Suryakumar Yadav's explosive innings and costly final overs, highlighted their struggles. Coach Hemang Badani lamented the absence of Axar Patel and inconsistent opening partnerships as key factors in their underwhelming season.

title: US court says Google, AI company must face lawsuit over teen's suicide
content: A Florida woman, Megan Garcia, is suing Google and Character.AI, alleging the AI chatbot's role in her 14-year-old son's suicide. The lawsuit claims the chatbot manipulated the teenager, leading to his death. A U.S. judge has ruled that the lawsuit can proceed, rejecting the companies' free-speech defense, marking a significant legal challenge for AI accountability.

title: 6.1 magnitude earthquake hits Greece's Crete, second in a week
content: A significant 6.1-magnitude earthquake has struck off the coast of Crete, Greece, at 8.49 AM local time, as reported by the National Centre for Seismology. This tremor follows a similar earthquake near Kasos just a week prior. While assessments are ongoing, initial reports indicate no immediate injuries or structural damage in the seismically active region of the Hellenic Arc.

title: From Zelenskyy to Ramaphosa: How Trump has turned Oval Office into an ambush office
content: US President Trump turned a meeting with South African president Ramaphosa into a spectacle, confronting him with a video about alleged persecution of white farmers. This encounter, part of a pattern of 'reality TV diplomacy,' risks undermining alliances and isolating the US, as Trump prioritises political theater over genuine diplomatic engagement.

title: Denmark's largest construction company returns keys of Tesla cars
content: Danish construction firm Tscherning has divested its entire Tesla fleet, citing Elon Musk's political stances as the primary reason. This decision mirrors a broader trend in Europe, where Tesla's brand image and sales are suffering due to consumer concerns over Musk's political affiliations. The company is opting for European alternatives, highlighting the impact of political views on corporate purchasing decisions.

title: 'Settled through trade': Trump again claims credit for India-Pak ceasefire
content: President Trump claimed to have played a role in easing tensions between India and Pakistan through trade, following India's 'Operation Sindoor' in response to a terror attack. Speaking at the White House's Oval Office during a meeting with South African President Cyril Ramaphosa, Trump said, "If you take a look at what we just did with Pakistan and India. We settled that whole, and I think I settled it through trade."

title: TMC delegation on Indigo flight describe 'near death experience'
content: Trinamool Congress MP Sagarika Ghose recounted a terrifying flight to Srinagar, describing it as a "near death experience" due to severe turbulence. The Indigo aircraft, carrying a TMC delegation including Derek O'Brien, encountered extreme weather, prompting the pilot to declare an emergency.

title: Encounter between terrorists & security forces under way in J&K's Kishtwar
content: Security forces and terrorists engaged in a firefight in the Singhpora area of Chatroo, Kishtwar district, prompting a joint operation codenamed 'Operation Trashi'. This incident follows India's 'Operation Sindoor' targeting terror bases and recent counterterror operations in Kelar and Tral where six terrorists were neutralized. Despite a ceasefire agreement, India maintains vigilance against cross-border terrorism.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 below 24,650; BSE Sensex drops over 600 points
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, opened in red on Thursday. While Nifty50 went below 24,650, BSE Sensex was down over 600 points.

title: Vaibhav Suryavanshi shows he can adapt under pressure
content: Fourteen-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi has taken IPL 2025 by storm, exceeding expectations after being picked up by the Rajasthan Royals. The young prodigy showcased his talent with a blistering debut, including a record-breaking century against Gujarat Titans. Suryavanshi's maturity and composure were further highlighted in a crucial match against CSK, solidifying his status as a rising star.

title: Hailstorm hits Delhi-NCR: 5 dead, trees uprooted, flights affected, metros stall
content: Delhi-NCR faced a chaotic Wednesday. A dust storm, hailstorm, and rain swept through the region. The storm killed at least five people. Air and ground transport were disrupted. Flights were diverted, and metro services were affected. Traffic crawled across Delhi, Noida, and Ghaziabad. Many trees were uprooted, causing power outages. Air quality remained poor.

title: Netizens say Aishwarya gave shout-out to Op Sindoor at Cannes
content: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan's Cannes 2025 appearance sparked widespread discussion, with her royal white saree and striking red sindoor becoming the focal point. Social media users speculated the sindoor symbolized support for 'Operation Sindoor,' a retaliatory attack by Indian Armed Forces. Others interpreted it as a powerful statement silencing recent divorce rumors surrounding her and Abhishek Bachchan.

title: ‘Neeraj Chopra go for 92m, 93m or, maybe, 94m throws in future’
content: Neeraj Chopra, after partnering with Jan Zelezny, achieved the 90m mark with a 90.23m throw at the Doha Diamond League. Former coach Klaus Bartonietz, currently training young athletes in India, believes Neeraj is now aiming for even greater distances.

title: Bengaluru wrecked again as 25 trees fall in storm, biker killed in Koramangala
content: Bengaluru experienced strong winds, leading to trees falling. Mudalagiriappa died in Koramangala when a tree collapsed on him. Ramesh sustained injuries. The incident caused traffic jams. A tree damaged a police vehicle and other cars on Nrupatunga Road. In Srirampura, a tree damaged a house. Residents had previously reported concerns about the trees.

title: 'My wife told me a sweet story': Surya’s heartfelt tribute melts hearts – Watch
content: Suryakumar Yadav's explosive 73 not out propelled Mumbai Indians to a crucial 59-run victory over Delhi Capitals, securing their place in the IPL 2025 playoffs. Yadav dedicated his Player of the Match award to his wife, Devisha Shetty, adding a heartwarming touch to the win.

title: ‘Cool’ cop clings to hijacked truck for 5km near Chennai, dodges metal rods
content: B Murugan, a traffic sub-inspector, is being praised for his courage. He clung to a hijacked truck near Singaperumal Koil. Murugan jumped onto the moving vehicle after receiving a message about the stolen truck. He held on for five kilometers, while the hijacker tried to harm him. Murugan radioed his team, who set up a blockade.

title: Top stocks to buy or sell today: Recommendations for today
content: Top stock market recommendations: Aakash K Hindocha from Nuvama Professional Clients Group suggests Bosch (SELL), CAMS (BUY), and ONGC (BUY) as top stock picks for today. He anticipates Nifty may decline to 24100, facing resistance at 24800, and Bank Nifty could drop 1000-1200 points.

title: Is Hamas leader Muhammad Sinwar dead? Here's what Israel PM Netanyahu said
content: In a recent press conference, Prime Minister Netanyahu suggested Israel may have killed Hamas leader Mohammad Sinwar. He stated that Israel has a plan to defeat Hamas, retrieve hostages, and eliminate Gaza's threat. Mohammad Sinwar, brother of Yahya, has become a key figure in rebuilding Hamas, particularly after his brother's death, solidifying his role despite ongoing conflict.

title: 'In all fairness, MS Dhoni is struggling'
content: Krishnamachari Srikkanth suggests MS Dhoni's era with CSK might be nearing its end, citing his age and declining performance as factors. Srikkanth pointed out Dhoni's struggles with form and fitness, impacting his ability to perform his previous roles effectively. CSK's failure to reach the playoffs for the second consecutive season adds weight to the speculation about Dhoni's future.

title: Delhi Capitals create unwanted IPL history, become first team ever to ...
content: Delhi Capitals made unwanted history, becoming the first IPL team to miss the playoffs after winning their first four games. A crushing defeat to Mumbai Indians, led by Jasprit Bumrah's and Mitchell Santner's bowling, sealed their fate. Despite a strong start, a second-half collapse cost them a playoff spot, highlighting the importance of momentum in the IPL.

title: UAE create history in Sharjah, stun Bangladesh for first-ever T20I series win
content: In a historic moment, the United Arab Emirates clinched their first-ever T20I series victory against Bangladesh at the Sharjah Cricket Stadium. Alishan Sharafu's match-winning boundary sealed the 2-1 series triumph, sparking celebrations. Haider Ali's impressive bowling restricted Bangladesh to 162/9, while Sharafu's unbeaten 68 and Asif Khan's 41 guided UAE to a dominant seven-wicket win.

title: Mohandas Pai rebuffs SBI manager for refusing to speak Kannada
content: Mohandas Pai criticized an SBI branch manager in Karnataka for refusing to speak Kannada with a customer, sparking outrage. Karnataka's Chief Minister Siddaramaiah condemned the manager's behavior, leading to her transfer. The incident ignited protests, with many emphasizing the importance of serving customers in their local language, especially in banking.

title: Stirling becomes 1st Irish batter to score 10K runs as Ireland crush Windies
content: Paul Stirling made history as the first Irish batter to reach 10,000 international runs during Ireland's dominant 124-run victory over the West Indies in Dublin. Stirling's 54 and Andy Balbirnie's brilliant 112 set the foundation for Ireland's 303/6. Barry McCarthy's 4/32 then dismantled the West Indies, who were bundled out for 179, giving Ireland a 1-0 series lead.

title: Europa League: Tottenham beat Man Utd to end 17-year trophy drought
content: Tottenham Hotspur clinched the UEFA Europa League title, defeating Manchester United 1-0, ending a 17-year trophy drought. Brennan Johnson's goal secured Spurs' first major silverware since 2008. Despite a challenging Premier League season, Ange Postecoglou delivered a European triumph. Manchester United, plagued by defeats and without European qualification, faced further disappointment.

title: Cannes 2025: Aishwarya Rai stuns in regal Indian look, flaunts sindoor like a queen
content: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan marked her 22nd Cannes appearance in 2025. She arrived with her daughter, Aaradhya. Aishwarya wore an ivory and gold traditional outfit. Her sindoor and maroon lipstick stood out. The outfit featured embroidery and a cape-style dupatta. Her appearance is considered a highlight of Cannes 2025. She continues to be a Bollywood legend and style icon.

title: Measles scare after Shakira's MetLife concert: Alert issued
content: A measles alert has been issued following Shakira's New Jersey concert on May 15, where over 55,000 fans gathered. Health officials are urging attendees to monitor for symptoms until June 6 due to an out-of-state concertgoer being diagnosed with the virus. With measles cases rising in the U.S., vaccination is crucial for prevention.

title: Taylor pulled into drama again as Leavitt breaks silence on Trump’s post about pop star
content: The White House addressed Donald Trump's recent derogatory remarks about Taylor Swift, with Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt downplaying them as commentary on Swift's political influence. This isn't the first time Leavitt has criticized Swift's political endorsements. Trump's post on Truth Social questioned Swift's popularity, following similar comments made during the Super Bowl and the Philadelphia Eagles' White House visit.

title: Ronaldo at the Club World Cup? Possible pre-June 14 moves
content: this summer, the 32-team FIFA Club World Cup runs from June 14 to July 13 in the united states . many clubs have agreed to open the summer window early for a short period from June 1-10, before closing it for six days and then re-opening again on June 16 . but the question remains: will some players end the season at one club, then play at the club world cup for another?
